means: 指挥的，根据命令（或要求）而作的

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"命令"之意。
means: command ： 较正式用词，强调权威性、全局性和强制性。
order ： 普通用词，侧重指具体的命令。
direction ： 正式用词，指口头或书面的指示或命令。内容不一定详尽，语气较缓和，不太强调强制性。也可指指导性的说明。
instruction ： 书面用词，指不容违反、不容推翻的命令。也多指包含具体说明的指示。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"命令"之意。
means: order ： 普通用词，多指上级对下级，主人对仆人以及教师对学生等发出的命令，也指态度专横地命令他人。
bid与order同义，但较正式，文学意味强，多指口头直接下的命令。
command ： 话意强，指正式下令，强调下令者的权威性，要求必须服从。

word_mean: "又称 :指挥控制与通信系统(C3 system,control and communication system) "
指挥控制通信与情报系统

sentence.Network_cn: 他得到军事指挥部授权，准备反击。

sentence.Network_cn: 他不仅仅发号施令，还身先士卒参加了几次激战。

sentence.Network_en: I left a sergeant in command and rode forward to reconnoitre.
sentence.Network_cn: 我留下一名中士指挥，自己策马前去侦察敌情。

jx.jx_en_mean: at someone's disposal to use or instruct
jx.jx_cn_mean: 由某人支配；听从某人的指示

lj.lj_ly: I shall defend myself with all the eloquence at my command.
lj.lj_ls: 我将用我所有的口才来为自己辩护。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Military)an order for a movement in a drill

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French comander 'to command', from late Latin commandare, from com- (expressing intensive force) + mandare 'commit, command'. Compare with commend

entry.def: If someone in  authority commands you to do something, they tell you that you must do it.

example.ex: He commanded his troops to attack...
example.tran: 他命令部队发起进攻。

example.ex: 'Get in your car and follow me,' he commanded...
example.tran: “上你自己的车，跟在我后面。”他命令道。

entry.tran: 博得，赢得，拥有(尊重、服从等)
entry.def: If you command something such as respect or obedience, you obtain it because you are popular, famous, or important.

example.ex: ...an excellent physician who commanded the respect of all his colleagues...
example.tran: 赢得所有同事尊敬的优秀的内科医生

example.ex: There is no limit to what can be achieved here because of the fantastic support we command.
example.tran: 由于赢得了极大的支持，我们将无往不胜。

entry.def: If an army or country commands a place, they have total control over it.

example.ex: The Royal Navy would command the seas...
example.tran: 皇家海军会控制所有海域。

example.ex: Yemen commands the strait at the southern end of the Red Sea.
example.tran: 也门完全控制着红海南端的海峡。

entry.def: An officer who commands part of an army, navy, or air force is responsible for controlling and organizing it.

example.ex: ...the French general who commands the UN troops in the region...
example.tran: 统率该地区联合国部队的法国将军

example.ex: He didn't just command. He personally fought in several heavy battles.
example.tran: 他不仅仅发号施令，还身先士卒参加了几次激战。

entry.def: In the armed forces, a command is a group of officers who are responsible for organizing and controlling part of an army, navy, or air force.

example.ex: He had authorisation from the military command to retaliate...
example.tran: 他得到军事指挥部授权，准备反击。

example.ex: The army's supreme command has said the army will withdraw, provided the other side does so also.
example.tran: 陆军最高司令部说如果对方撤退，他们的部队也要撤退。

entry.tran: （某一指挥官统率的）部队，兵团，军区
entry.def: In the armed forces, a command is a group of soldiers that a particular officer is in charge of.

example.ex: There would continue to be a joint command of US and Saudi forces operating within Saudi borders.
example.tran: 美国军队和沙特军队共同组成的联合部队将继续在沙特阿拉伯境内实施军事行动。

example.ex: ...the Strategic Air Command.
example.tran: 战略空军司令部

entry.def: In computing, a command is an instruction that you give to a computer.
If someone has command of a situation, they have control of it because they have, or seem to have, power or authority.

example.ex: Whoever was waiting for them there had command of the situation...
example.tran: 在那边等候他们的人控制了局势。

example.ex: Mr Baker would take command of the campaign...
example.tran: 贝克先生会负责这次运动。

entry.def: Your command of something, such as a foreign language, is your knowledge of it and your ability to use this knowledge.

example.ex: His command of English was excellent.
example.tran: 他精通英语。

example.ex: ...a singer with a natural command of melody.
example.tran: 天生乐感很好的歌手

entry.tran: 居高临下;俯瞰;清楚地看到
entry.def: If a place commands a view, especially an impressive one, you can see the view clearly from that place. If a person commands a view of something, they can see it clearly from where they are.

example.ex: The house commanded some splendid views of Delaware Bay.
example.tran: 从这座房子可以俯瞰到特拉华湾壮丽的景致。

example.ex: ...a point of rock, from which we could command a view of the loch.
example.tran: 可以对整个海峡一览无遗的布满岩石的岬角

entry.tran: (技术或资源)可运用自如，充分运用，可支配
entry.def: If you have a particular skill or particular resources at your command, you have them and can use them fully.

example.ex: He came from the Sudan without a word of English at his command...
example.tran: 他来自苏丹地区，一句英语都不会。

example.ex: The country should have the right to defend itself with all legal means at its command.
example.tran: 国家有权运用一切合法手段保卫自身安全。

entry.def: If you are in command or in command of yourself, you are relaxed and able to react and behave in the way that you want to.

example.ex: Nixon looked comfortable and in command...
example.tran: 尼克松看上去镇定自若。

example.ex: The man appeared to be in complete command of himself.
example.tran: 那个男人看上去神态自如。

means.word_mean: 1. an authoritative direction or instruction to do something
2. a military unit or region under the control of a single officer
3. the power or authority to command;

sentences.sentence: "the materials at the command of the potters grew"
"the corporation has just undergone a change in command"

means.word_mean: 6. great skillfulness and knowledge of some subject or activity;
7. (computer science) a line of code written as part of a computer program

sentences.sentence: "The author commands a fair hearing from his readers"

means.word_mean: 5. exercise authoritative control or power over;

auth_sentence.content: It was a typical announcement from the coalition command.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was a typical announcement from the coalition command.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was a typical announcement from the coalition command.

auth_sentence.content: Several of them met us at the command center.
auth_sentence.res_content: Several of them met us at the command center.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Several of them met us at the command center.

auth_sentence.content: Blackwell was...a linguist with a command of twenty languages.
auth_sentence.res_content: Blackwell was...a linguist with a command of twenty languages.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Blackwell was...a linguist with a command of twenty languages.

Sentence.sentence: In 1976, the company commanded 90% of the market for photographic film and 85% of the market for cameras.
He commanded absolute loyalty from Apple users.

sentences.en: The general issued a command that all of them should come at six o'clock.
sentences.cn: 将军颁布了一道命令, 所有的人都要在六点钟到。

sentences.en: The army is under the king's direct command.

means.word_mean: 掌握; 运用力, 控制力

sentences.en: He has a good command of French.

means.word_mean: 部队, 兵团; 指挥部

sentences.en: Do you know where's the United Nations Command?
sentences.cn: 你知道联合国部队司令部在什么地方吗?

sentences.en: You have no right to command.
I advised him to command his temper.
sentences.cn: 我劝他控制自己的脾气。

sentences.en: The general commanded his men to attack the city.
He commanded that man go at once.
The hill commands a fine view.
sentences.cn: 从这座山上可以俯瞰到周围的一片美景。

sentences.en: The captain of a ship commands all the officers and men.
sentences.cn: 舰长统率舰上的全体官兵。

jushi.english: He has a good command of French.
The army is under the king's direct command.
Do you know where's the United Nations Command?
jushi.chinese: 你知道联合国部队司令部在什么地方吗?
